Description: Conical food sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip on exterior, glazed streaky black (fired brown) with traces of two added white bands near bottom of foot; underside unslipped; inscription on underside.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding Simple Animal Style chalices with painted bands, see Lemos 1991, no. 938 from Tarentum, no. 952 from Thessaloniki and no. 956 from Histria.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1061) (phase 2)
